intro: Orthaea oriens, commonly known as the oriental orthaea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Orthaea oriens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent.
